plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A bulbous perennial known for its early spring blossoms, often poking through late winter snow, signaling the start of spring in temperate regions.
plants.location: Native to Europe; cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Crocuses can bloom through snow, warming the air around their flowers to melt the frost early.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub prized for its large, elegant flowers that bloom in the cooler months, providing vivid color in winter gardens.
plants.location: Native to Japan, Korea, China; widely cultivated in mild climates
plants.funFact: Camellias were named after the Jesuit botanist Georg Kamel, even though he never studied this plant.

plants.name: Mimosa pudica
plants.description: A tropical plant noted for its small, fluffy pink flower heads and its rapid leaf-folding movement when touched.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in frost-free climates; often blooms in January in tropical areas
plants.location: Native to Central and South America; naturalized in tropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Its leaflets fold inward and droop when touched, possibly as a defense mechanism against predators.

plants.name: Banksia marginata
plants.description: A shrub or small tree producing cylindrical flower spikes rich in nectar, important for native birds and mammals in Australia.
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers open sequentially from the bottom up, which helps pollinators feed efficiently.
